title.narrative: Humanitarian response to displacement in Mohmand Agency, Pakistan

description.narrative:
2. Sandard NFIs are distributed to families as they arrive. Families larger than 6 members are entitled to two tents. 3. 20 Communal tents are pitched for community activities. 4. Firewood for cooking are distributed to all camp residents for winter months.. 5. Cooked meals are provided to newly arrived families until they receive WFP food ration. • Community participation enhanced through Age, Gender, Diversity Mainstreaming 1. 5 Community Centers and 5 Women Centers established and maintained. 2. 20 community service staff recruited and functional. 3. Shura committees at different level formulated and meet regularly to discuss and decide issues directly relating to IDPs 4. 9,000 meters of Purda walls constructed.
• Emergency warehousing 1. UNHCR emergency warehouse in Ghalanai for Mohmand Agency is maintained; 2. Stockpiling, loading and transportation of relief items are properly implemented.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

name.narrative: Mohmand Agency of the Federally Administrated Tribal Areas, Pakistan

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Humanitarian response to displacement in Mohmand Agency, Pakistan

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
